data.title: Can't wait to come back!!
data.text: I'm new to Tyler and wanted something different to do..... Decided to go to a 1980's John Hughes movie. The theater is beautiful Art Deco  and clean and comfortable. The movie was funny and the crowd was appreciative. I ended up going back the next week for another movie. Now I find myself checking their event calendar to make sure I have opened up my schedule so I can attend more. Liberty Theater is going to be my new favorite thing !!

data.title: didn't go there for many reasons, go to Tx State Railroad instead
data.text: go to Palistine rr to rusck, also the Cherokee safari (best ever) lots of lake fishing, boat rentals and other stuff to do in Tyler

data.title: fund raising
data.text: nice venue. we had fun with the hope haven fund raising event. it is a very special place. we look foward to our next visit to the theater.

data.title: Christmas Favorite!
data.text: My wife and I love going here to watch the old Christmas movies on the big screen. It's become a tradition that we look forward to. The place is very beautiful and the staff is super friendly. There are a few nice restaurants close by as well.

data.title: Wonderful small, comfortable theater
data.text: The Liberty features live musical groups, plays and old movies. Located on the square in downtown Tyler.  Ample parking on the street or in the new City parking garage around the corner (on Broadway). Several restaurants on the square conveniently located.

data.title: Nice Venue
data.text: I have attended numerous concerts here and it's always nice.  I saw "Elvis" a few years ago and then some local events.  I remember when this was a popular movie theatre and going there now brings back lots of memories.  I love the way they have remodeled!

owner_response.author: Anne P, Manager at Liberty Hall, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi! I see that you gave us a nice review but only one star. Was there something we need to improve on?

Thanks,
Anne Payne
Liberty Hall Manager
apayne@tylertexas.com
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very Nice Venue
data.text: I've been to Liberty Hall several times for different shows.  It's always a very nice place to go - my favorite is the seasonal movies they offer.  The used to book really great concerts but now it's more film festivals and comedy club type stuff.  Wish they'd bring back the concerts.

data.title: Great Venue
data.text: The old theater has been totally renovated and is a beautiful example of art deco. Not sure on seating but maybe 150 or so. Every seat is good and the sound is perfect. Saw Guy Clark there about 4 rows back and we all had conversation with him. He said it was one of the best acoustic venues he had played. Also saw Ruthie Foster there and a play and a documentary movie release. Highly recommend. They don't have enough live performances but hopefully that will change.

data.title: EXCELLENT, well kept, retro FREE drinks and they even do wedding rentals!!
data.text:
Have spent a many a date nights here. Friendly, always smiling helpful staff and volunteers. They even rent the place out for events and weddings. Should you get a chance to take in a show or movie here, go for it, complimentary beer and wine accompany some events.

A Tyler jewel, and in a great location in the heart of downtown and with the free parking garage after hours nearby the entire set up has always been well enjoyed and appreciated by my family and friends.

data.title: Don't miss it!
data.text: We went to the East Texas Comedy Festival here and it was fantastic! The theater is well maintained and the event was highly entertaining. They have events and they show movies throughout the year so we will definitely be back. We weren't sure what to expect but we were not disappointed.

data.title: Great place!
data.text: The Liberty Theatre is a really fun place to see movies, plays, and way more! They have all kinds of different things they do there, so be sure to check out the website ( http://www.libertytyler.com/ ) for what all they have going on! Also, a cool thing is that if you volunteer, you can attend some shows for free! I'm not sure of the specifics, as it is my mom that does that, not me, but I know she has some great opportunities to help out and see some really fun shows!

data.title: An Affair To Remember
data.text:
What a wonderful Valentines date for my husband and I. Love this theater and all the people who volunteer to make it available!!!
This has become our romantic venue ❤️!

data.title: Love the nostalgia!!!
data.text: Great restoration! Good view from pretty much anywhere. Really nice variety of events. Not so small that it feels cramped but small enough to feel intimate.

data.title: Nice venue
data.text: NIce venue, nicely re-done in an art deco style.  Seating provided good view of the stage; good sound.  Only issue was reserved seating.  Apparently this event was the first time they had reserved seating versus open seating; many people found the seats they reserved were not where they thought they were.

data.title: Quaint
data.text: Saw Edwin McCain and Michaelis here on a Saturday evening. It is a lovely venue; small and intimate. Enjoyed the feel if being so close with the singers.

data.title: Redone theater for downtown activities.
data.text:
This is a redone theater that was sponsored by the city. It houses the city orchestra and plays classics movies when special activities are not taking place. Historic downtown square renovated.

There are shows and tickets that cost as any regular show would cost.

data.title: Nice, vintage theater
data.text: Went with a group to watch "its a Wonderful Life".  I enjoyed the restored theater. It is a small theater with not a lot of seating, but it is worth visiting.

data.title: Went to a concert here..
data.text: This is a small venue.. nice, clean downtown, near great resturaunts.  I like that it was small and you can see the stage from every seat.

data.title: Okay
data.text: The theater is pretty, but the film leaves something to be desired. It's about as quality as watching it on a home projection screen.

owner_response.author: Anne P, Manager at Liberty Hall, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
So sorry you did not know Take 2 was playing at Liberty Hall last March. If you have signed up for our email updates and are not recieving our emails, please let me know. Sometimes it may be caught in a spam filter. I did send several out regarding Take 2 and the show did sell out.

Thanks,
Anne Payne
apayne@tylertexas.com
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Get place, needs to be better organized
data.text: Like the bands that appear here.  Did not get notified that Take-2 was coming.  This is ridiculous, I'm on their mailing list
